page.title: 01Stroma
page.content: Stroma is an island in the Pentland Firth 3 kilometers north west of John O'Groats in Caithness. The island is 3 kilometers long and 1 1/2 - 2 kilometers wide. It was inhabited until tht 1960s when its economy declined and it was abandoned. There are several crofts and a school all of which are now derelict. Its only inhabitants now are the lighthouse keepers in the lighthouse at the north end of the island at Swilkie Point. This area of the survey only includes part of the foreshore on the north eastern side of Stroma. Access to the island is difficult as there is no longer any boat service to Stroma.
